content:
Public stream created by Dave Register. Description:

No description.

Gentlemen...

Time to go around the horn and begin to "feature-freeze" OCPN 5.10.

What I'd like to know is this:

1.  Are you working on (or thinking about) any user-visible new features that you would like to incorporated in O510?

2.  Are there any hidden and as-yet incomplete structural changes you think are important  for O510?

I know of a few things here going on, some stirrings in the engine room.  It is time to convert this ad-hoc list into a workable punch-list for tracking.

For my part, I am:

a.  Planning to add some sort of signalK message tracking to NMEA Debug window.

b.  Thinking randomly about some improvement to the default backing chart.  Something "nicer" than GSHHS.

c.  Daily work against the github issues list, concentrating on marked, reproducible bugs.

I have two features I really want to finish for 5.10

  • The initial config wizard, working on it right now
  • Cached online tiles (I have the network part ready and the rendering will be very similar to MBTiles, should not take too long to finish)

I have partly implemented new basemap based on OSM data converted to tiled Shapefiles (more accurate, more detailed and unlike GSHHG maintained)
And I have GeoTIFF support prototype, just not ported to Windows.

@Pavel Kalian
I guess the new OSM basemap plan will leverage the cached online tile capability? And we would host the tiles somewhere?

No, two different things. The cached tiles are for bitmap tiles, satellite photos etc.
The basemap is built on https://osmdata.openstreetmap.de/data/land-polygons.html land polygon dataset. We need it to be vector for the land crossing functionality. And shapefiles as technology, because going forward we actually need generic shapefile support as there are many interesting datasets available in this format.
We of course could also provide low-res tiled bitmap basemap, will be colorful, but with no real value...

I want to get #3391 fixed and is working on it. As completed this should not be user visible, although I plan for some temporary configuration while testing.

A PR is not far away.

.  Planning to add some sort of signalK message tracking to NMEA Debug window.

Nice! I think enough info: Specified Self-data used by O and AIS-MMSI

I think I'm done with the wizard for now.
It still needs more heurisitcs for the different N2K formats in FirstUseWizImpl::SeemsN2000, but I don't have the hardware or recorded traffic. And more general testing, especially on Windows with USB devices.
A message was moved here from #OCPN 5.10 Release plan > Packaging by Alec Leamas.
Alec Leamas has marked this topic as resolved.
